item.title: Art of Shellcoding: Tale of the Smallest Reverse TCP Shellcode
item.description: Modern Ninja :) Hey Folks, Hope you guys are doing great. In the previous article, we saw how we can create a bind TCP shellcode, reduce its enormous length from 108 bytes to merely 80 bytes by making use of strategically placed instructions, register re-use, single byte instructions and much more. We also saw how we can create a wrapper in python which will help us modify the shellcode and make it usable for any port of choice.
